definition: to hope for sth/to count on/hope
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: I fully expected one of the women to volunteer6, as was usually the case.
sentences.chinese: 我满心指望像平常一样，某位女士能毛遂自荐。

sentences.english: This event had at last been despaired of, but it was then too late to be saving.
sentences.chinese: 这个指望落了空，如今省吃俭用已经太迟了。

sentences.english: Nowadays people look to technology as an alternative source of satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 现在人们指望科技能成为满足感的另一个来源。

sentences.english: Hope and courage are two bright diamonds in the crown of success.
sentences.chinese: 指望战英勇是胜利之冕下两颗敞亮的钻石。

sentences.english: You lean upon a broken reed, if you trust to their compassion.
sentences.chinese: 你若是指望他们的同情，那你就等于倚在破苇杆上。

sentences.english: You would not expect him actually to perform those degrading acts?
sentences.chinese: 你并不指望他真的干出这些有失身份的事？

sentences.english: You want the chanterelles there and you always want the bins full because your customers expect them, " says D'Onofrio.
"We cannot count on the government for anything, " says Mr Chou of HTC.
sentences.chinese: “我们什么都不能指望政府，”HTC的周永明表示。

sentences.english: Moscow also counts on historical amnesia.
sentences.chinese: 莫斯科还指望“历史健忘症”能够起作用。

sentences.english: Don’t expect to start eating perfectly and exercising religiously tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 不要指望开始狠狠的吃然后明天就虔诚的运动。

sentences.english: What can you expect from a dog but a bark.
sentences.chinese: 你所指望于狗的只有吠声。

sentences.english: We're all just waiting with breath to see what you can do around here.
sentences.chinese: 我们都在屏息以待，指望您在这儿大展身手咧。

sentences.english: We cannot calculate upon having fine weather for the sports meeting.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能指望着开运动会时会有个好天气。

sentences.english: If you expect to enter the university, you should apply now.
sentences.chinese: 要是你指望进入大学，你此刻应该声请。

sentences.english: A heart, which can bear beautiful expectation, will never wither.
sentences.chinese: 能生出美好指望的心是永远不会凋败的。

definition: an extravagant hope/to have excessive expectations
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
otherwise/or else/or
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
from the start/absolutely/entirely/simply
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
impossible/cannot/not able
in short/in a word/in brief
only if (..., or otherwise, ...)/only when/only in the case that/unless
as before/(same) as usual/in the same manner/still/nevertheless
granted that/even if
to have expectations/to earnestly hope/expectation/hope
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to think about it
provided that/supposing that/if
